definition: to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep

sentences.english: They are cruel killers, breathing fire and capturing women.
sentences.chinese: 他們是殘忍的殺人魔鬼，能夠噴火，還掠取婦女”。

sentences.english: If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 如果它被納粹掠取，黑暗的軍隊就會開進到整個世界。

sentences.english: Does karma factor in when a shark snatches up a fish?
sentences.chinese: 當一隻鯊魚掠取一隻魚時是因果報應嗎？

sentences.english: During inspiration plunder or in the process of creation, play fast and loose is its form of expression.
sentences.chinese: 在靈感掠取或創作過程中，反覆無常是它的表現形式。

sentences.english: the act of robbing someone at gunpoint.
sentences.chinese: 持槍相威脅，掠取他人財物的行爲。

sentences.english: I’m always happy to avoid a corporate cash grab.
sentences.chinese: 我很樂意躲開這種公司趁機掠取現金的行爲。

definition: variant of 掠奪|掠夺[lu:e4 duo2]
to rake in (money)/to plunder/to milk people dry
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to take cities and seize territories (idiom)
